body.en:
We are proud to present the Manufacturing X Sales Platform (MX) product release 1911! With this release, In Mind Cloud (IMC) continues to focus on improving the outstanding usability and core features to maximize the value of existing features for our customers.

To better support the core quoting process, we introduced various new features and enhancements, like the Pre-Submit check to ensure accurate product and pricing in case of changes in the offering during the sales cycle. We have also launched a Pre-Filtered User List for Task Assignments to empower easier and smooth collaboration among regional and functional teams. The new Enable/Disable the Function for price information on the Line Level helps prevent possible pricing errors by human error. We also present numerous improvements on the usability of MX, such as consistent user preferences by storing personal setting information in the server-side. Furthermore, we redesigned the quote page to show critical information such as the pricing date at first sight. What more? We also added a few sophisticated tool-support features to enhance project delivery for our implementation team.

1. Pre-Submit Check

When users submit a quote to trigger the approval process, MX can automatically enforce a series of validations as below: 

  • Highlight inactive products and force a user to pick alternatives.
  • Replace configurable products with pre-configured variants 
  • Enforce product substitutions defined in the backend.
  • Update configurable products to their latest version

 

We also introduce a manual option to run these checks at any point in time during the quote preparation stage. Our beta users gave us the feedback that this feature has been very helpful to ensure correct products, configurations, and pricing, even before submitting a quote for approval.  

 

Some additional considerations cater to improve the user experience: 

  • Customers can decide which of these checks apply for their business 
  • MX will pre-select options based on a user’s previous selection 
  • When there is only one option configured, MX will skip the user selection pop-up

Figure 1 - Pre -Submit Checks Options

 

Figure 2 - Pre-submit Checks result page

1.1 Enable/Disable cells in the Line Item View based on product 

MX has a robust pricing engine to empower customers to always have the latest and correct cost and pricing information. Discounting, manual pricing and costing are common quoting practice. However, this does not hold true for all products and product categories. Products might not be discountable, manual price input might be forbidden, or the price might be computed based on the products bill-of-material for solutions and projects. There are numerous special cases where a user should not be able to add manual price inputs. 

 

As of today, MX not only has the capability to customize the UI display in terms of hiding or disabling cost and price columns in the line item table based on customers’ business needs, but also to control this behavior on product level and line item level.  

Figure 3 - Editable and read-only cells per product level under quote line item view 

 

It is possible to easily define a global, system-wide behavior as per below, for instance, to determine that a regular product is discountable and does not allow to override the list price. 

Figure 4 -  Admin product settings under system level

 

On the product level, the setting can be tweaked, for instance, to allow manual list price input on a product for special requests or services. On the other hand, we can disallow discounts for solution products, which price is computed by its components.

Figure 5- Admin product settings under the product level

 

MX also allows to perform mass updates for the settings applying to multiple products. 

Figure 6 – Mass update product settings

1.2 Filtered user lists for task assignments 

MX serves as a collaboration platform for users from cross-functional teams (e.g. sales, design, engineering and product) to prepare a quote collectively. MX supports this through the Route feature, i.e. to assign tasks to different functional experts so they provide certain inputs.  

To ensure ease in use, MX now allows custom filters by a Groovy extension point to show a sales user only the relevant personnel, e.g., within a certain functional and regional scope.  

Figure 7 - Route user list customizing filter 

 

1.3 Account selection customizing filter enhancement 

MX already supports customized filter options for account selection during quote creation with a Groovy extension point. In Mind Cloud has further enhanced the system to be able to support direct linkage with all account data such as assigned sales area, country and region from address even across multiple-layer data linkage filtering.  

Figure 8 - Account selection customizing filter

 

1.4 Consistent user preference settings across browsers and devices 

To provide a personalized user journey, MX allows users to customize and define their own preferences based on how pages and views represent data, e.g. predefined filters, sorting, columns to show or hide and preserve last selected options. Previously, these preferences were stored within the browser. To provide a consistent user experience across browsers and devices, MX now stores user preferences on the server-side. This mechanism also applies to other features such as Pre-submit Check and Find Similar Quote searching criteria.

 

1.5 Pricing date in quote page 

MX shows a quote’s key information on top of the quote page, i.e. quote name, quote ID, quote version, quote revenue, and its currency to give users a high-level overview without opening the details of the quote. MX now displays the Pricing Date, too as it is one of the critical input parameters in many business scenarios.  

Figure 9 - Quote header with pricing date

1.6 Sales Text Determination by Reference Distribution Channel and Division 

MX supports to retrieve Sales Text information from ERP, which then can be displayed and printed accordingly based on different sales organization, distribution channel and division selected. Some of our customers maintain their data in ERP through reference distribution channel and reference division which simplifies the data maintenance on ERP side a lot.  

To be able to support our customers’ master data strategy, MX opens a Groovy extension point. This enables our implementation teams to manage the mapping between quote level distribution channel and division information with the reference ones. Ultimately, MX will be able to show and print the right sales text maintained.  

Figure 10 - Reference Distribution Channel and Division for Sales Text 

 

1.7 Users list downloading 

MX supports various types of master data downloads, including Products, Product Attributes, Quote Data, and most recently also user information. This helps in ease of user list validation across global organizations.

Figure 11 - Users list downloading screen

• Other enhancements 

Some other enhancements in the sales process were also delivered. These include: 

  • Child line items positioning capability using ERP’s configuration and pricing engine 
  • Conversion of a contact details page from a popup to a regular view to improve UI consistency 
  • Show material numbers for ERP error messages when the actual error is not sufficient 
  • Better handling of attribute locales in scripts and output templates for printing purpose 
  • More price columns are added in the Line Item Table view for additional display purpose 
  • Defaulting template is enabled for Additional Proposal reports  
  • Show meaning full error message during KB Upload or Dynamic Attribute Upload if same name is found

 

  • Bugfixes and Cleanup  

Improved BOM Explosion with Multi-value DA and enhanced the audit for Compiling KB 

  • Improved sales item position to have right order based on BOM Entry Position definition after KB based BOM Explosion and fixed to put the user added item to be at the last item after system exploded item 
  • Improved IMCScript’s sort function for sales item  
  • Improved to show popup when admin set the maintenance mode 
  • Improved rendering is not re-firing issue when updating Configurator Preference 
  • Others
